meaning: Any cell that contains a nucleus storing genetic information. Found in plants and animals, and much larger than prokaryotic cells. Usually between 10 and 100 µm in diameter
A small type of cell without a nucleus - genetic material is a DNA loop, which may have one or two rings of DNA known as plasmids. Usually between 0.1 and 5.0 µm in diameter
An organelle found in eukaryotic cells that contains genetic material.
A fluid-like substance found in cells
The partially permeable membrane that controls what enters and leaves a cell
An organelle responsible for protein synthesis
An organelle found in plant cells that is responsible for photosynthesis
An organelle found in plant cells that stores cell sap
The outer layer of plant and algal cells responsible for strengthening the cell. Made of cellulose
A cell that has adapted to carry out a particular function
A sub-cellular structure specialised to carry out a particular function
